website_summaries.verdict: A good value on this micro-fiber fleece liner that can give you a little extra warmth on cold camping nights.
pros: Can double as a blanket when unzipped
Zipper can be used in either direction
Unique blended material of microfiber and fleece is very soft, but does not make you too hot
Easy to get in and out
cons: The material can become full of static at times

customer_reviews.title: Strong Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: This microfiber fleece sleeping bag insert was everything I needed to keep my daughter and I warm in the cool nights of fall camping. The fleece is soft, the stitching appears to be quality, and it is very roomy. My only disappointment was the overpowering chemical smell that came with the insert. I washed with free & clear detergent, baking soda, and vinegar in our washing machine for a normal length wash. It still had a very strong scent. I am going to keep washing it until I can get the scent out, as the insert itself and softness of the fleece is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Pusheen

customer_reviews.title: I took this product on a winter campout in Alaska ...
customer_reviews.text: I took this product on a winter campout in Alaska. The temperature was forecast to be between 0-10 degrees F. My sleeping bag is only rated down to about 20F. So I was hoping to bridge the temperature gap with this. It did seem to do the trick. It felt nicer than my sleeping bag and kept me a little warmer. However this product when packaged for a backpacking trip was bigger than what my sleeping bag stuffed down to and was maybe a little less than twice the weight of my sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: Solid travel blanket or sleeping bag liner.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Packs easily. + Very soft. + Does not smell after a few nights using as a sleeping bag liner. *Temperature dropped down below 20 degrees Fahrenheit or - 7 degrees Celsius. + Good as a blanket around the house. Cons: - Zipper broke on one of the two fleeces I bought. - Microfiber fleece becomes staticy after washes without dryer sheet
customer_reviews.author: RoRo

customer_reviews.title: I love this fleece blanket
customer_reviews.text: I just got my blanket and can't wait to take it with me backpacking. I was so cold the last time I slept in my tent and I wish I would have had this item. It weights 1 lbs and it packs small. I efinitely recommend it. I see some people asking about the material. It is not only fleece, it is a mix of fleece and microfiber, which is so much better because it packs smaller but still has the same warming capability.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Lover

customer_reviews.title: Warm and soft wrap that will keep you cosy and will extend your sleeping bag life.
customer_reviews.text: I travel and camp half of the year ( travel photographer), but in the last years have been sleeping cold and cold has been keeping me awake, Ordering fleece liner solved that problem. Also, over the years I noticed that the sleeping bags age quickly and lose the original quality insulation, as I am a clean freak and wash them very frequently. A liner allows you to skip washing and thus extends the life of the sleeping bag. And this liner is well made, warm and soft, and it is totally worth buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie B.

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but fleece binds.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fleece for its warmth. But as a liner in a sleeping bag, not so much. The fleece wants to cling to your sleepwear and gets tighter and tighter making moving difficult. This might be the same with all fleece bag liners. I don't know. Get a better sleeping bag if you need to add warmth. I do like the zipper and use it as a light quilt. The stuff sack is cheesy if you use it a lot like I do. The size is a bit small for me, 5'8", 180#. For kids doing an inside sleep over? Perfect. Couch throw? Great. Winter camping bag liner? Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight cover or bag liner
customer_reviews.text: This is a lighter weight fleece than some I've used, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. Perfect for warmer climates. It packs up to about the size of a round oatmeal container. It also works well unzipped and used flat as a blanket.
customer_reviews.author: curlygirl

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the smell out
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my granddaughters when we go hunting for added layer of warmth. Don't think I will ever be able to use it for that purpose. Have washed it 5 times, hung it out during pouring rain storms and let it hang on the line for days and days and still can't get the smell out. Nothing to lose, so I'll keep hanging it outside and hope the smell someday go's away.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty much the same thing across brands but the sleeve is a little nicer and more durable than others I have bought. Adds noticable warmth inside a normal sleeping bag and is comfortable on its own in warmer weather. These make sleeping in a synthetic fiber sleeping bag much more pleasant and eliminates the sticky feeling associated with traditional mummy style bags. When not needed inside your bag they make a nice buffer between your bag and the ground. Used as a pad they make the cold hard ground much more pleasant to sleep on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very soft and warm!
customer_reviews.text: Used as an insert for my 15 degree bag while hiking and camping in below zero weather. I was very happy with the results. This liner added a nice amount of warmth and I was impressed with how soft it is. My only complaint is the stuff sack is very cheaply made. It tore on the second day of camping. Luckily I had a spare sack to place it in for the remainder of the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Own One
customer_reviews.text: Warm. Snuggly. Compact. I bought this for my son to use on a week-long backpacking trip in the mountains so that the could take his little 50-degree sleeping bag and still stay warm. It was light and didn't take up much room in the pack. My other son likes it for hammock camping on warm nights. Where we live, it's usually in the 60s or 70s at night, so a regular sleeping bag is overkill. This is the perfect solution. The zipper works great and it's super easy to put back into the carrying case. And since it's fleece, it's easy to wash and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Soft, warm, comfortable, roomy and great for below freezing temps
customer_reviews.text: While my sleeping bag was a 30 degree bag, I was hesitant to camp in weather that was estimated at 29 over night. A friend suggested a sleeping bag liner and OMG, it was the best investment. With the exception of the one night that dipped below freezing, I didn't even need the hand/foot warmers I bought. This kept me warm an toasty and it had plenty of room in both width and length. I was able to wrap it around my ears, fully stretched out. A great buy. A great price!
customer_reviews.author: A'ra Blair

customer_reviews.title: Cumphy and cozy!  For camping or just around the house.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my grandsons, but I have one just like it. I’ve used it inside a sleeping bag for extra warmth, and I’ve used it on top of a sleeping bag when it’s too warm to use the bag itself. My GS loves his, he’s sick and using it as a blanky around the house. Everyone should have one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger/Okay Liner
customer_reviews.text: This is more so the size of a small blanket rolled up but enlarges to something that will cover you. It isn't very warm though. I was looking for something to use in the summer as a blanket for camping and a liner in the winter but this is way too big to add on for backpacking. It's also not very warm. It went down to maybe 60° and I was cold with just this which advertises as going down to 55°. Just make sure it fits your needs. It is a nice picnic or house blanket though....
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my mom
customer_reviews.text: My mom has alzheimer's and has trouble keeping the covers on herself at night. This sleep bag completely unzips all the way around to lay out flat so that it is easy to maneuver her into it and then we zip it up around her. She stays cozy and warm all night! It works perfectly for her!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Hale

customer_reviews.title: KEEPS ME WARM!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am ALWAYS cold. ALWAYS. And backpacking is something I always didn't want to do because I knew I'd be freezing cold at night, no matter what kind of bag I had. But this has changed all that. I actually stay warm now, even in really cold temps (30 degrees F at the lowest, so far). It's lightweight, washes up well, and is easy to use. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my camping sleeping system
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for summer camping to use as a stand alone sleeping bag and it served me well in 60° but I appreciated it even more when I used it as a sleeping bag liner in my 20° bag at temps around 35°. As a cold sleeper, using this inside my sleeping bag allowed me to sleep in just gym shorts and I stayed plenty warm.
customer_reviews.author: CesarGPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Essential for camping and travel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use while travelling long-distances by train/bus/car. I needed it to be more compact than my sleeping bag (which is made of down and for mid-mild winter) but also cosy enough to keep me feeling warm and content. I usually use a weighted quilt and this isn't that, but it was heavy and snug enough to keep me happy over a 9 hour train trip and I'll definitely use it in the future over my sleeping bag if possible. It's very lightweight and compact so perfect for when you're staying in hostels or hotels and need something a little extra or as an in-between.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. I weighed it and it is 1 lb 2 oz with the pack. I will use it instead of a sleeping bag during warmer months. Just what I needed for my overnight backpacking trips
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cool nights.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Perfect for cool nights all by itself. Then used it as a sleeping bag insert for comfort against skin. Good all by itself till about 60 degrees, then put on some jammys to make it to 50 degrees, then go with the sleeping bag. Exactly what I wanted. A quick, light, answer instead of using a sheet for the camper.
customer_reviews.author: James Fallon

customer_reviews.title: Not only is it very soft to the touch (feel like fleece) and comfy to sleep in
customer_reviews.text: This saved me! Not only is it very soft to the touch (feel like fleece) and comfy to sleep in, it fits into your sleeping bag. I apparently bought a sleeping bag that had already been used (found some gross hairs in there), and thankfully I had this liner that protected me from the used sleeping bag. You can also open it up to a full size blanket if you fully unzip it. Very versatile and compact - love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Florence

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cold camping
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and worked as described. We used for camping and temperature was around 15 in the night. I was comfy and warm inside the liner. I definitely recommend this for cold campers. I expected little bit more soft and bigger in size.
customer_reviews.author: kesava

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hammock backpacking/camping.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for hammock overnight camping in Hawaii, as a bag seemed too much for that scenario. A backpacking friend in Hawaii said hammock with rain fly/mosquito net and a bag liner was the way to go. Glad I took her advice. Thin, comfy, just enough warmth for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: This was easily my best piece of new car camping gear this year.
customer_reviews.text: I spent two weeks camping my way around British Columbia this year at the beginning of July, which made for some cool and rainy nights. While my down bag would have been more than enough to keep me warm, it felt so nice to cocoon myself in this liner and then curl up in my sleeping bag. For obvious reasons it's not as light or packable as my silk liner, but it's so much warmer and comfortable for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these (2) for camping in the summer, in a hammock. When it would really be too hot for a regular sleeping bag. So you can either use one at a time or both, which is nice. They're soft and good quality and clean up well. They're also light to carry for backpacking, and have nice colors. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Echo

customer_reviews.title: super soft and warm
customer_reviews.text: super soft and warm. Great for relaxing in a hammock. They pack down really well and are great to take along when traveling anywhere. Would be a good blanket to keep in an emergency kit. Can also work as a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: oliveforhealth

customer_reviews.title: This fleece microfiber bag liner is much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This fleece microfiber bag liner is much better than I expected. It is more than wide/longer enough to fit in my bag and is rated to 50 degrees by itself so, here in FL/S. GA it may be all that I need in the spring through the fall. No odor to it just out of the pkg.
customer_reviews.author: docgobbler

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The Osage River fleece zippered sleeping bag liner worked like a proverbial charm. The zipper made slipping in and out very easy and the fleece kept me warm. It also folded very neatly into its carrying case. Reasonably priced as well. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: George N. Vourlojianis

customer_reviews.title: Nice travel accessory.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for travel so I don’t have to sleep on unknown sheets. It is lighter material than expected but does the job. Had some difficulty getting it to roll back up.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin E. Taylor Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Cozy Winter Campout
customer_reviews.text: This really made a difference on our winter campout. Temps got quite cold inside our unheated cabin and I was still much warmer in my winter sleeping bag with this liner than with my old liner. I brought some extra blankets too, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great liner! very soft and warm
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't roll up small enough for backpacking unless you are using it as your sleeping bag. It has a great zipper. Plenty of room. Very soft!! Really added some warmth to my bag. Very nice, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Warm but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on vacation because the comforters in motels are too heavy and warm. This was perfect. It takes up very little room and is warm without being heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Bet

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to a mid-temp sleeping bag to make it more versatile! Strong zippers, ultra soft and comfortable, and just plain nice to have along. Well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome B. Omara

customer_reviews.title: too thin and low quality
customer_reviews.text: too thin and fabric quality is low. scratchy and very thin - can see through the fiber clumps
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Silinskas

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and warm
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this is lightweight but still very warm. It has a drawstring on the top, to keep it snug around you, it is also very long, so I was able to snuggle all the way to my shoulders. I used this alone and it had gotten pretty chilly, but I was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CGPoels

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: I brought this on a backpacking trip on the AT during the fall. This along with a lightweight quilt gave me the perfect amount of warmth and flexibility during the fluctuating fall temps.
customer_reviews.author: ceg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for summer!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag liner is perfect in the summer by itself. It's really light weight and rolls up nice and small. Plus, being fleece is big plus with me. I think everyone who camps, should get themselves one or two. It also zips up just like a regular sleeping bag. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Reverend James.C.Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t underestimate these
customer_reviews.text: Added so much warmth to a 50° sleeping bag while camping in 40 and below weather. I was only in shorts and a T-shirt and I was extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like this liner very much. Came in a very nice portable bag which I like. Very soft Microfiber Fleece material. The only thing is I wish I could open it up all the way like flat bed sheets. Folding and putting it away is very convenient I like that. Shipping was also very fast. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Richgal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cool weather comfort
customer_reviews.text: This fleece liner is exactly what I was looking for. It worked very well to keep me comfy while sleeping. I use it as a sleeping bag when the temperature is too warm for a full blown bag, but cool enough to need a blanket. Very soft too.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: not the same
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever had this liner before be warned. They are half the density and a foot shorter. I will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: medcare651

customer_reviews.title: Good for a liner, but not as a stand alone blanket
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it but my husband used it on his last deployment and said he needed another blanket on the ship. So maybe use it as a liner or with something else, but I'm guessing by itself, it's pretty light and not extremely warm.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and cozy
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a travel bag for the plane / bus but I also used it in our hotel on chilly nights. It rolls up neatly into the carry bag and was easy to take with me.
customer_reviews.author: Janvier

customer_reviews.title: Very good light weight sleeping bag liner
customer_reviews.text: Very good light weight sleeping bag liner, very soft and good fit. This is the second one I got and really like it.
customer_reviews.author: JDachefFriest

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very cozy and warm given the lightweight fabric. Very soft as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ajedeja

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too large for backpacking, spend more on a sea to summit liner for something packable ok for car camping
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adds warmth
customer_reviews.text: The fleece liner is thin enough as not to take up too much room, but still thick enough to add some warmth. It’s also good by itself as a warm weather sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Works great and warm in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a camping trip in Colorado. It was in the mid to low 40's at night and this liner was a great supplement for my sleeping bag. Warm and soft and worked great as a blanket at times when it was cold during the day. Washes easily and very portable in the carry storage bag. A great buy if you do not want to invest in another sleeping bag rated for colder climates.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Leuzinger

customer_reviews.title: Cozy addition to sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to our camping trip to the mountains. Made our sleeping bags warm and cozy
customer_reviews.author: gojoinla

customer_reviews.title: no
customer_reviews.text: Looked like other ones we have but it made the kids itch and breakout. Cut it up for car wash.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bates

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine when I work shifts as a paramedic on an ambulance. Sometime I have to bounce between stations in the middle of the night. This is in my bag where I can use it at any place. I love the ability to crawl in it as a sleeping bag in the quarters, or open it up and just spread it out over me as a blanket. The warmth, softness, and comfort give you that warm fuzzy feeling when you need the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Scott

customer_reviews.title: Smelly
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly functional if you a re normal. I have severe chemical allergies and this thing smelled. Company was great about refund, tho.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect summer bag.
customer_reviews.text: Nice durable lightweight bag. Great for warmer weather or as a liner in cooler weather.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: nice product will stop the cold nylon sleeping bag issues
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brood

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blanket/Bag
customer_reviews.text: This little blanket/bag works great for when you don't need much. You can either climb in and use it like a sleeping bag or unzip and use it as a blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Nice fleece sleeping bag. Basically a fleece blanket with a zipper. Light weight for my backpacking trip and good for cool weather. Not meant for extreme cold temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight for shelter in storm season bug out.
customer_reviews.text: Added these to our bug out supplies for hurricane season.
customer_reviews.author: DLDC

customer_reviews.title: warm
customer_reviews.text: These are really great to have if you need just a little warmth or add to sleeping bag for more warmth.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great buy fleece bag liner.
customer_reviews.text: The liner is as advertised. Well made with it's own stuff sack for convenient storage and packing.
customer_reviews.author: DMK

customer_reviews.title: Kept my daughter nice and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Previous campout my daughter said she was really cold, got her this and a pair of long johns she said she was too hot. Next night slept without the long johns and said it was perfect with just the liner.
customer_reviews.author: kh

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Fits inside my large size sleeping bag perfectly. Adds extra layer of warmth for those spring and fall camping and backpack trips.
customer_reviews.author: Estima8tor

customer_reviews.title: Good liner
customer_reviews.text: The velcro tab is not necessary and got stuck in my hair
customer_reviews.author: Scopel2004

customer_reviews.title: fit my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I have a corner apartment in Chicago and if the wind is blowing the right way and it's below 0 it's so cold. Bought this and a red one to use under the covers. Perfect! Soft, warm, and cocoons you without the claustrophobic feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too thin and narrow
customer_reviews.text: This liner is simply too narrow and short for an adult sized bag. The material is also too thin. I returned it..
customer_reviews.author: JazzmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Loved these ordered one to try it out in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved these ordered one to try it out in the Upper Peninsula in Michigan. Loved it so much we ordered 2 more. It got really cold at night and this bag liner kept us very toasty. We have also used these in the late summer months by themselves. Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Christie Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Many uses for one product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect lining for the inside of a sleeping bag. You can take it out and wash it although I haven't yet Been using it mainly laying on the couch. Many uses. I can see keeping it in the car for emergencies also.
customer_reviews.author: Oso Negro

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable liner for sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Used during a backpacking trip in January 2016. It is fairly light, a little bulky, but worth the room it takes up in your backpack. Very nice, comfortable liner for my sleeping bag. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: smart

customer_reviews.title: good item
customer_reviews.text: good quality item. Very soft. Bad part, Very lightweight not for less than 50 F
customer_reviews.author: mark w.

customer_reviews.title: for us this worked well. impressed! only problem ...
customer_reviews.text: for us this worked well. impressed! only problem I experienced was my feet. once they were cold nothing kept them warm not even wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: MnM

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it when I knew our campout would be cold. It added several degrees of comfort without adding much weight. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: J Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Warm, lightweight and cozy
customer_reviews.text: Love this blanket. It is so warm and it rolls up nicely into the provided pouch.
customer_reviews.author: wirethings

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for inside my sleeping bag. Love that it zips all the way down. It is soft and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are terrible
customer_reviews.text: The zipper broke with in the first couple of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this as an extra layer in my sleeping bag but it was too heavy for backpacking and without any way to secure it to the inside of my bag, I found myself fighting all night to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie R. Huff-Evans

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight, soft and easy to roll into bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight, soft and easy to roll into bag. Will use to add to sleeping bag warmth in winter and think it will work alone in hot weather. Also good for hostel stays.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great price
customer_reviews.text: Really like them, I bought 3 for my 2 grandsons and I to use for camping
customer_reviews.author: M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I was very impressed how soft and comfortable these were
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed how soft and comfortable these were. Great as a sleeping bag liner, or to take to use in a hotel bed..
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I was toasty and comfortable. It is a thin material
customer_reviews.text: I have an ancient but barely used sleeping bag that doesn't really have soft material inside. I dreaded sleeping in it. I bought this fleece insert and boy what a difference. I was toasty and comfortable. It is a thin material, but perfect to put inside a sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A perfect cozy fleece blanket (or wrap) for camping in cool ...
customer_reviews.text: A perfect cozy fleece blanket (or wrap) for camping in cool weather or just hanging out on cool evenings. This was a great addition to my campling gear for Ragnar trail races. It doesn't take much room to pack and is so cozy.
customer_reviews.author: NGonce

customer_reviews.title: it was so great to have a warm liner to put in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently went trekking through the Himalayas. The tea houses are very cold at night, it was so great to have a warm liner to put in my sleeping bag at night. I slept comfortably every night.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremi Broadhurst

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! As expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! As expected! Added to my son's sleeping bag for scouting camp outs and now he wonders why he didn't have it before now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Feels great !!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Very soft to the touch with a little added warmth on cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: MRM

customer_reviews.title: Soft and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: So soft! Have not camped with them yet but they are nice to even snuggle in at home with hot chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Cozy blanket, extra warmth
customer_reviews.text: This bag liner is great for car or boat camping. It's a cozy blanket when sitting outside reading and adds extra warmth in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: TAWR

customer_reviews.title: not for really cold nights
customer_reviews.text: This product is good for outdoor summer camping. It will not help for winter cold nights for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Elen Dumanyan

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm when it dropped to the 40s in Yosemite
customer_reviews.text: Packs small and is nice to have for a little extra warmth on chilly camp nights.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I decided to leave this behind because I had a ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to leave this behind because I had a 15 F bag. But this by its self will keep you warm
customer_reviews.author: kilo

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weight for cozy evenings in front of the TV watching movies. Nice and soft and not too warm. Works great in colder weather inside a sleeping bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: Emerald R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel. good bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel. good bag. pretty thick feeling. Should at 10 degrees tolarance to my bag and will feel nice to sleep in. No 5 stars yet as I have not needed to use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Greasy to increase warmth factor.I
customer_reviews.text: Was a Christmas gift for my young nephews. They lived then
customer_reviews.author: leadfoot_88

customer_reviews.title: WORKED OUTSIDE A SLEEPING BAG IN 30 DEGREE WEATHER
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I'm in boy scouts and I camp alot and my sleeping bag needed a liner I chose this one because I could just tell it would keep me warm worked perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for summer camping trip. Leave in my motorhome as a backup.

customer_reviews.title: warm, packs small
customer_reviews.text: I had to wash it to get the chemical smell out but all is well after one heavy washing.
customer_reviews.author: Darlynne D. Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have not field-tested this yet, but size and comfort level seems perfect

customer_reviews.title: Great Liner
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice item to use with the sleeping bag purchased

customer_reviews.title: Fluffy
customer_reviews.text: Huge, warm and fluffy. Lightweight, It's exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Alot softer then i thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Marie Macri

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Great liner for those colder nights in the tent. I have two, and they zip together perfectly to fit inside our two sleeping bags :)
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Very good liner, kept me warm.
customer_reviews.text: Very good fleece liner. Used it inside a 40 degree sleeping bag and a 15 degree mummy bag and it felt very cozy and kept me warm. The only issue I had was with the packing size. It would pack about 15-20 percent bigger than what I'd have liked but overall a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and exactly as was described. Seems to be high quality used four nights last trip and was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brendonp

product_meta.title: OSAGE RIVER Microfiber Fleece Sleeping Bag Liner
feature_bullets: Designed with versatility in mind, these fleece sleeping bag liners can add extra warmth to your sleeping bag and double as a cozy blanket for relaxing at home
Dimensions while zipped are 70 inches long, 31 inches wide; unzip to use the sleeping bag liner as a blanket
These open up to 6 feet yet pack down to 6 inches and weigh a total of 1 pound, making them ideal for travel to sporting events, campsites, outdoor concerts, and picnics
Includes an accessory bag for easy transport during backpacking, camping, and scouting events; rated to 50 degrees Fahrenheit
Crafted with microfiber fleece, the sleeping bag liners are fully machine washable and available in a range of vibrant colors
